cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles SE of Naples, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then curving northwest toward the northern Gulf Coast (LA–MS area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Ochlockonee River to Okaloosa/Walton County Line (FL Panhandle)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southwest and west-central Florida coast, Florida Panhandle, Alabama, Mississippi, and southeast Louisiana coasts
weather_observation.wind: Intermittent tropical-storm-force gusts (up to 40 mph) possible Saturday afternoon into early Sunday; overall sustained gale probability remains below 20 %.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–2 ft possible along Tampa Bay and adjacent barrier islands due to onshore flow as the system exits to the west.
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 2–4 in with isolated spots to 6 in; scattered flash-flooding risk in low-lying and poor-drainage areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning this weekend; isolated tornado threat over west-central Florida Saturday.
